 btw, here's a completely unaffiliated ad to Kelutral if you want more resource to learning Na'vi: https://kelutral.org

This app downloads information from Reykunyu (https://reykunyu.lu) (https://github.com/Willem3141/navi-reykunyu). 
 This app does not contain any dictionary or translation data on it's own, they're all downloaded and then displayed in app. 
 
 
 The online translation search data is downloaded during search, then processed and displayed in app. Aside from the query and search language, no other data is sent. 
 For the offline dictionary, it is downloaded and cached onto the device, where it's processed and searched on-device. However, the audio and image data are still downloaded from Reykunyu during runtime. 
 The app features real-time search suggestions, the contents in the search box will be automatically sent to Reykunyu, in order to receive the suggestion data. The type of data sent is the same as the online search. 
 
 
 The logos (icon and banner) of Reykunyutsyìp are made by me (Kip). Not to be confused with the logos of Reykunyu. (Reykunyu data credits) 
 Dictionary data 
 The offline dictionary cache data is licensed under CC-BY-SA-NC 3.0(https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/). This excludes the Annotated Dictionary data, the audio files, and the animal drawings—these are copyrighted by their respective authors. 
 The base dictionary data was taken from Eana Eltu by Mark Miller, Tirea Aean, and others, and then edited further by Eana Unil, Tekre, and Wllìm. The Annotated Dictionary definitions were taken from the Annotated Dictionary project by Plumps. 
 
 Audio 
 The voice clips were provided by Plumps (who recorded them for dict-na'vi(https://dict-navi.com)) and tsyili (who recorded them for Learn Na'vi(https://learnnavi.org/navi-vocabulary/)). 
 
 Artwork 
 The drawings of Pandoran animals were made by Eana Unil. (Haven’t encountered one yet? Try searching for [toruk]!).
